instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: 820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
threads.message:
hey ;)

820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works :

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> 3.32v
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_Z2</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_CUMULUS</SIGNAL> 0v

thks

threads.title: 820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
threads.message: <SIGNAL>5V_S5_CUMULUS</SIGNAL> should be present and comes from <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>, is that one present?

threads.title: 820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
threads.message: Oh yeah L5800 is not mounted so no voltage there. Have you tried a known good trackpad?

threads.title: 820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
820 3115 cursor doesn't move but clicking works
threads.message: Did you measure 18V5 with the trackpad plugged in? Did you swap the complete trackpad with cable for a known good one?
